alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 4:26AM CDT until April 22 at 1:36PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 49.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM CDT Thursday was 49.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 51.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 51.4 feet on 05/18/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon.
